channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Pickford on England records, World Cup dream & love of motocross
item.description: Jordan Pickford sits down with Kelly Somers to discuss life at Everton, keeping clean sheets for England, a World Cup dream and a love of motocross.

item.title: 'From black and white football to full colour' - Emery's three years at Villa
item.description: As Unai Emery marks three years at Aston Villa, Guillem Balague looks at his journey to Villa Park and his bid to "awaken the giant".

item.title: Being dropped for Hampton 'felt unjust' - Earps
item.description: Former England goalkeeper Mary Earps claims she told Lionesses boss Sarina Wiegman she was rewarding "bad behaviour" when she recalled Hannah Hampton to the squad despite previously dropping her.

item.title: 149 Turkish officials suspended in betting probe
item.description: The Turkish Football Federation (TFF) suspends 149 referees and assistant referees for allegedly betting on matches.

item.title: It's the buzz - Salford new boy Borini on playing on as a veteran
item.description: Fabio Borini made a combined 131 appearances across five years for Liverpool and Sunderland - now he is getting his football fix at Salford City.

item.title: How new MLS franchise San Diego are creating history
item.description: San Diego FC may be a new MLS franchise, but they are making history built on the principles of the Right to Dream project.

item.title: Can you name the line-ups from Aston Villa 7-2 Liverpool?
item.description: Aston Villa and Liverpool meet at Anfield on Saturday, but can you name the line-ups from Villa's shock 7-2 win in 2020?

item.title: Reasons to be cheerful at last? Amorim's year at Man Utd
item.description: As Ruben Amorim reaches his first anniversary as Manchester United boss, there are finally reasons to be cheerful for the club.

item.title: One Boxing Day game down to Uefa - Premier League
item.description: The "expansion of European club competitions" has led to there being just one top-flight game on 26 December, says the Premier League.

item.title: O'Neill not imagining repeat of 'Demolition Derby'
item.description: Martin O'Neill's Old Firm debut win became known as the 'Demolition Derby', but Celtic's interim manager would "settle for a really lousy 1-0 victory" over Rangers this time.

item.title: Luton beat Forest Green in rollercoaster seven-goal tie
item.description: Luton Town reach the FA Cup second round with an injury-time winner after Forest Green Rovers stage a remarkable comeback from three goals down in a thrilling first-round encounter.

item.title: Augsburg v Dortmund halted after fireworks land on pitch
item.description: The Bundesliga match between Augsburg and Borussia Dortmund is halted after spectators send fireworks onto the pitch.

item.title: 'It's an addiction' - Borini on continuing career at Salford
item.description: Salford City forward Fabio Borini discusses the reasons behind his move to the League Two side following his departure from Sampdoria.

item.title: 'It's irresponsible' - Glasner upset by Palace's congested schedule
item.description: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner calls on the Premier League, Uefa and Fifa to act after finding out about his side's congested fixture schedule.

item.title: 'The FA Cup is at it again!' - First-round shocks
item.description: From the Class of 92's Salford City stunner, to Warrington Town punching 100 places above their weight, relive some of the biggest upsets from the first-round proper from recent years.

item.title: Palace fixture pile-up 'irresponsible' - Glasner
item.description: Manager Oliver Glasner says it would be "irresponsible" for Crystal Palace to play two games in three days following a fixture pile-up after reaching the EFL Cup quarter-finals.

item.title: Fans, Fosun & future - what next for struggling Wolves?
item.description: Fosun will celebrate a decade in charge of Wolves next year. They could be marking it in the Championship.

item.title: 'I'm completely happy' - Slot backtracks on squad comment
item.description: Manager Arne Slot backtracks on his assertion that Liverpool's Carabao Cup exit had given "a little insight" into his squad's depth.

item.title: 'I'm not Schmeichel in disguise - I am just Senne Lammens'
item.description: New Manchester United goalkeeper Senne Lammens tells BBC Sport he is not scared by taking one of the most scrutinised roles in the modern game.

item.title: Three parties give proof of funds to buy Sheff Wed
item.description: Three parties give the administrators of Sheffield Wednesday proof of £50m funds to take over the Championship club.

item.title: Ex-England keeper Earps announces 'happy' same-sex relationship
item.description: Earps has been supported and encouraged by her former Lionesses teammates to open up about her sexuality.

item.title: Same dream, different styles as St Mirren & Motherwell bid for final
item.description: With Saturday's Scottish League Cup semi-final looming, Motherwell and St Mirren share the same dream - but who will come out on top?

item.title: Intriguing stories & big names in action: FA Cup first-round preview
item.description: Former winners facing off, local derbies, giant-killings and upsets, here are five things to look out for in this weekend's FA Cup first round.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Football Manager, the game
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on the computer game Football Manager 26 with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Inter Milan join Guehi race - Friday's gossip
item.description: Inter Milan join race for Marc Guehi, Everton monitoring Nicolas Jackson, and Manchester United face competition for Ayyoub Bouaddi, plus more.

item.title: The La Liga innovator out to prove his old club wrong
item.description: As Eder Sarabia heads back to Barcelona, the Elche boss tells Guillem Balague about his indifferent playing career, his famous father and his return to La Liga.

item.title: Has England's Euros triumph given women's club football a boost?
item.description: One of the constant refrains throughout England's triumphant run at Euro 2025 – and indeed most women's football matches in recent years – has been how important the success of the Lionesses has been for the growth of the game. But what has been the impact?

item.title: Agyemang will be back 'without a doubt' after ACL injury
item.description: Michelle Agyemang has the strength to reach her potential despite rupturing her anterior cruciate ligament (ACL), say her managers at Arsenal and Brighton.

item.title: Rodgers changed Celtic landscape - McGregor
item.description: Former manager Brendan Rodgers "changed the landscape massively" at Celtic, while his assistant John Kennedy leaves "a big hole", says captain Callum McGregor.

item.title: How to follow the FA Cup on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the FA Cup first round on TV and radio this weekend.

item.title: Gainsborough boss skips niece's wedding for cup tie
item.description: Gainsborough Trinity boss Russ Wilcox hopes he is spoiled for party choices after Sunday's FA Cup tie against League Two side Accrington Stanley.

item.title: 'I don't know where my medal is' - Macey
item.description: Colchester United goalkeeper Matt Macey plays down the fact that he has an FA Cup winners' medal.

item.title: Sears' Jammers hunting FA Cup shock at Port Vale
item.description: Maldon & Tiptree's Freddie Sears admits the underdog tag does not sit comfortably with him heading into Sunday's FA Cup tie at Port Vale.

item.title: Why 'grump' Paterson is treating Brackley like Arsenal
item.description: Notts County boss Martin Paterson says his team are preparing for non-league side Brackley as if they were facing Arsenal in the FA Cup.

item.title: Father and son sharing Hemel FA Cup adventure
item.description: Manager Lee Allinson is hoping Hemel Hempstead can pull off an FA Cup shock at Wigan and is leaning on father Ian, who works alongside him, for advice.

item.title: When is the FA Cup second round draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at the FA Cup's second round draw, ball numbers and prize money on offer.

item.title: Guirassy fires Dortmund to victory against Augsburg
item.description: A solitary Serhou Guirassy goal is enough to give Borussia Dortmund victory against Augsburg in the Bundesliga.

item.title: Lammens on Man Utd 'pressure' & Schmeichel comparison
item.description: Manchester United goalkeeper Senne Lammens tells Betty Glover how he deals with the "pressure" of being number one at Old Trafford and dealing with fan comparisons to Peter Schmeichel.

item.title: Watch Stewart's winner as Dunfermline beat Ayr
item.description: Watch striker Barney Stewart score his third goal in three games on loan from Falkirk as Dunfermline Athletic beat Ayr United 1-0 to replace their hosts in third place in the Scottish Championship.

item.title: Watch Wilshere and Savage's FA Cup goals
item.description: Watch the three FA Cup goals scored by Jack Wilshere and Robbie Savage, who meet as managers in the first round on Friday evening.

item.title: Slot 'completely happy' with Liverpool squad
item.description: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot says he is "completely happy" with his current squad - backtracking slightly on his recent suggestions that he was concerned about the depth available to him.

item.title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
item.description: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

item.title: Former Hereford boss Addison dies aged 85
item.description: Former Hereford United manager Colin Addison - who was in charge when the Bulls beat Newcastle United in the FA Cup in 1972 - dies at the age of 85.

item.title: Triple up on Crystal Palace? The FPL talking point
item.description: Expert FPL Heisenberg and the guys from the FPL Podcast by BBC Sport debate this week's FPL talking point.

item.title: West Ham's Paqueta warned over FA rule breaches
item.description: West Ham's Lucas Paqueta is reprimanded and warned about his future conduct for his failure to comply with a FA investigation into spot-fixing allegations.

item.title: Wembley & Cardiff bid for UCL finals - how are hosts decided?
item.description: How are stadiums selected for European finals and who will host them in 2026 and 2027?

item.title: Do Liverpool fans think Slot is under pressure?
item.description: After six defeats in their past seven games, BBC Sport spoke to Liverpool fans to find out what's going on this season and how they feel towards manager Arne Slot.

item.title: No McKenna Celtic talks as Bellamy commits to Wales
item.description: Ipswich Town's Kieran McKenna says he has had "no conversations" with Celtic about their managerial vacancy, while Wales head coach Craig Bellamy is committed to seeing out his team's World Cup campaign.

item.title: How Thiaw became Newcastle's 'mentality monster'
item.description: Newcastle United broke their transfer record to sign Nick Woltemade, but another German signing has also made a big impact.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: 'Clickbait kills everything' - Amorim and Dyche go head to head
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim and Nottingham Forest boss Sean Dyche both respond to the Englishman's comments from earlier this year that he would win more games as Red Devils manager using a 4-4-2 formation.

item.title: 'It felt like the right decision' - Slot stands by team selection
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says he has "no regrets" after making 10 changes to his team for their Carabao Cup fixture against Crystal Palace, a match they went on to lose 3-0 at Anfield.

item.title: 'I don't want to be hearing that at home' - London City confessions
item.description: London City Lionesses players including Danielle van de Donk, Jana Fernandez and Kosovare Asllani share their confessions about their team-mates in Confession Cam.

item.title: Eze and Alexander-Arnold star in best goals from last season's FA Cup
item.description: Ahead of the first round proper of this season's FA Cup, watch the very best goals from the 2024/25 competition, including Eberechi Eze's quarter-final strike against Fulham.

item.title: Wiegman 'not very positive' about Agyemang injury
item.description: England manager Sarina Wiegman says she is "not very positive" about Michelle Agyemang's injury after the forward was carried off on a stretcher during their friendly win against Australia.

item.title: Best finisher? Toughest opponent? - Shearer answers your questions
item.description: Alan Shearer answers questions from the BBC Sport audience (and Dion Dublin) on Football Focus at Newcastle's St James' Park.

item.title: Super Bowl winner offers to train Kane
item.description: Former Kansas City Chiefs punter and Super Bowl champion Dustin Colquitt says England dootball captain Harry Kane would be "fantastic" in the NFL if he decides to switch to the sport in the future and offers to coach him.

item.title: Rodgers v Desmond: Analysing the Celtic fallout
item.description: BBC Sport Scotland's chief sportswriter Tom English breaks down the public statements of Dermot Desmond and Brendan Rodgers to try to get to the bottom of the claims and counter-claims at Celtic.

item.title: Season of the set-piece - how open-play goals are falling out of fashion
item.description: Set-piece goals have been the story of the Premier League this season. BBC Sport examines their increasing importance.

item.title: Stole a penguin, jailed in Singapore, now Aberdeen sporting director
item.description: Lutz Pfannenstiel has stolen a penguin, spent 101 days in jail accused of match-fixing, modelled for Armani - and is Aberdeen's new sporting director.

item.title: When Gazzamania came to Kettering
item.description: Paul Gascoigne was one of the best English players of the last 30 years but his managerial career lasted only 39 days. BBC Sport looks back.

item.title: Chelsea's James on love of fashion & friendship with Hamilton
item.description: Reece James has progressed from the Chelsea academy to club captain, overcoming a number of injuries along the way.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Is Delap banned in Premier League after EFL Cup red card?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Chelsea striker Liam Delap will serve a Premier League suspension after being sent off in the EFL Cup.

item.title: Why are teams making substitutions in the first minute of matches?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why clubs in the National League Cup are making substitutions in the first minute of games

item.title: Is masked Premier League star allowed to play in Baller League?
item.description: BBC Sport explains the Premier League rules on whether a Premier League player can really feature in Baller League UK.

item.title: What is the Fifpro World XI?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifpro World XI is, who votes for the award and when the winners will be announced.

item.title: What does it mean when a club enters administration?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at what it means when a club enters administration.

item.title: What is the Premier League multi-ball system?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the rules of the Premier League multi-ball system and what happened in Liverpool's defeat against Manchester United.

item.title: When did a non-Old Firm team last win a Scottish title?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the last time a team other than Rangers or Celtic won Scottish football's top flight division.

item.title: Rangers 'didn't screw up' head coach appointment
item.description: Chairman Andrew Cavenagh insists Rangers did not "screw up" the process to appoint head coach Danny Rohl but admits it looked "clunky" from the outside.

item.title: What did we learn from Rohl's Rangers unveiling?
item.description: Danny Rohl understands the need to win quickly as Rangers head coach and says he can handle pressure, as chief executive Patrick Stewart and sporting director Kevin Thelwell come under fire.

item.title: Winning & togetherness - Rohl sets out Rangers mission
item.description: Danny Rohl delivers a simple message as he is introduced as Rangers head coach, stating: "We want to win."

item.title: 'Rohl jumps from Wednesday frying pan into Rangers furnace'
item.description: Danny Rohl has taken on one of the toughest managerial jobs in world football by succeeding Russell Martin at Rangers, writes Tom English.

item.title: 'A proud club dragged into gutter'
item.description: Kevin Muscat is the latest to be ruled out of Rangers' manager search - so what do fans make of the process, and who do they want now?

item.title: Juventus sack manager Tudor after seven months
item.description: Juventus sack head coach Igor Tudor with the side eighth in Serie A after weekend defeat by Lazio.

item.title: Real Madrid impress but Vinicius tension grows - Clasico talking points
item.description: Spanish football expert Guillem Balague analyses a fiery Clasico at the Bernabeu, which saw Real Madrid beat Barcelona but Vinicius Jr vent his frustration.

item.title: How Flick has revived Rashford's career at Barcelona
item.description: How his role and the system Barcelona use is getting the best out of on-loan Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford.

item.title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 to be named on 25 November
item.description: Voting for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 has now closed.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
